tit.cmt: ・このファイルでは、「薙刀」を、場合により①道具としての「薙刀」と、②「薙刀術」との2つの意味に使い分けているようです。訳者はここのタイトルを②と解しました（後列参照）。
タイトルなので説明訳を削除しました。

sen.j: なぎなた（薙刀）とは、日本の古い武器である薙刀の木刀及び竹刀に似たなぎなたを使った現代武道。
sen.e: Naginata wielding techniques are the modern martial art, using a wooden or bamboo sword which looks like the old Japanese weapon called "naginata" (originally, a pole with a wood shaft & a curved blade on its end).
sen.cmt: ・このセルの冒頭の「薙刀」は②、2番目・3番目のそれは①、と解しました。 ・原文は、全体的にその意味を十分には把握できませんでしたが、以下の内容に解して訳しています。「薙刀術とは、日本の古い武器である薙刀に似せた木刀、ないし竹刀を使った現代武道。」
sen.e: Naginata wielding techniques are a modern martial art, using a wooden or bamboo sword which looks like the old Japanese weapon called "naginata" (originally, a pole with a wood shaft & a curved blade on its end).

Naginata (wielding techniques) is a modern martial art, using a wooden or bamboo sword which looks like the old Japanese weapon called "naginata" (originally, a pole with a wood shaft and a curved blade on its end).
sen.cmt: 説明訳を括弧に入れました。&をandに訂正しました。

sen.j: 鉄砲の伝来と共に戦場では使われなくなった武術の薙刀術のうち女薙刀が、明治末から大正にかけて女子の武道として発展。
sen.e: With a harquebus introduced in Japan, naginata wielding techniques became rare to be used at the battlefield, but from the last days of the Meiji period to the Taisho period, they partially revived as the martial art for women, which was called "onna naginata" (women's naginata).

With a harquebus introduced in Japan, naginata wielding techniques became rarely used on the battlefield, but from the last days of the Meiji period to the Taisho period, they were partially revived as a martial art for women, and this was called "onna naginata" (women's naginata).

With a harquebus introduced in Japan, naginata wielding techniques became rarely used on the battlefield, but from the last days of the Meiji period to the Taisho period, they were partially revived as a martial art for women, and this was called "onna naginata" (women's naginata).
And they have kept their lives as such until today;
And they have kept their lives as such until today;
And they have kept their lives as such until today.
sen.cmt: ;を削除し、ピリオドに訂正しました。

sen.j: （ただし、なぎなた制定時に参画した流派の大部分は男薙刀の流派である）
sen.e: however, it was mostly the schools of "otoko naginata" (men's naginata) that participated in the process of establishing the naginata wielding techniques.
sen.cmt: ・ここの「なぎなた」は②に解しました。
sen.e: however, it was mostly the schools of "otoko naginata" (men's naginata) that participated in the process of establishing the naginata wielding techniques.
(However, it was mostly the schools of "otoko naginata" (men's naginata) that participated in the process of establishing the naginata wielding techniques.)
sen.cmt: 原文に合せて（）に入れ、Howeverを大文字にしました。

sen.j: 防具は剣道の面、胴に独自の小手、すね当てである。
sen.e: The protective gears are "men" (a face mask) & "do" (a breastplate), which are both the same as those of "kendo" (a traditional Japanese swordplay), and "kote" (padded gloves to protect the wrists and forearms) & "sune-ate" (leg guards), which are peculiar to naginata wielding techniques.

The protective equipment are "men" (a face mask) & "do" (a breastplate), which are both the same as those in "kendo" (a traditional Japanese swordplay), and "kote" (padded gloves to protect the wrists and forearms) & "sune-ate" (leg guards), which are peculiar to naginata wielding techniques.

The protective equipment are "men" (a face mask) and "do" (a breastplate), which are both the same as those in "kendo" (a traditional Japanese swordplay), and "kote" (padded gloves to protect the wrists and forearms) and "sune-ate" (leg guards), which are peculiar to naginata wielding techniques.

sen.j: 袴の形状も大きく異なっている。
sen.e: The shape of "hakama" (a long, pleated, culottes-like Japanese garment) is quite different from that of kendo.
The shape of "hakama" (a long, pleated, culottes-like Japanese garment) is quite different from that of kendo.
The shape of "hakama" (a long, pleated, culottes-like Japanese garment) is quite different from that of kendo.

sen.j: 一般に女性の武道というイメージが強いが、なぎなたは男性も行うことが出来る。
sen.e: Naginata wielding techniques are generally imaged to be the women's martial art, but they are also men's one.
Naginata wielding techniques are generally imagined to be women's martial art, but they are also used by men.
Naginata wielding techniques are generally imagined to be women's martial art, but they are also used by men.
AJNF integrated many schools' various naginata wielding techniques into the sole standards.
AJNF integrated many schools' various naginata wielding techniques into the sole standards.
AJNF integrated many schools' various naginata wielding techniques into the sole standards.

sen.j: 段級位制をとっている。
sen.e: AJNF grants graduated ranks to its members according to their ability.
AJNF grants graduated ranks to its members according to their ability.
AJNF grants graduated ranks to its members according to their ability.

sen.j: 日本体育協会、日本オリンピック委員会に加盟。
sen.e: AJNF joined Japan Amateur Sports Association & Japanese Olympic Committee.
AJNF joined Japan Amateur Sports Association & Japanese Olympic Committee.
AJNF joined Japan Amateur Sports Association and Japanese Olympic Committee.

sen.j: 試合競技と演技競技がある。
sen.e: There exist two types of competitions, the naginata match & the naginata performance.
